com.xtructure.xevolution.operator
Interface MutateOperator<D>

Type Parameters:
D - type of data used by Genomes on which this operator is applied.
All Superinterfaces:
EvolutionObject, Operator<D>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AddLinkMutateOperator, AddNodeMutateOperator, AdjustAttributesMutateOperator, ArithmeticMutateOperator, ArithmeticMutateOperator, CopyMutateOperator, OperatorWorkbench.MutateOperatorAlias, RemoveLinkMutateOperator
public interface MutateOperator<D>
extends Operator<D>

The MutateOperator describes the methods used in reproduction via mutation, or generally, with a single parent.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

Method Detail

mutate

Genome<D> mutate(int idNumber,
                 Genome<D> genome)
                 throws Operator.OperationFailedException
Creates a child Genome using the given parent Genome.

Parameters:
idNumber - the instance number for the id of the child Genome
genome - the parent Genome
Returns:
the child Genome
Throws:
OperationFailedException - If this mutate operation cannot be applied to the given Genome
Operator.OperationFailedException
